1322221111112.content:
Your mouth dropped open as soon as you had heard what Megan said. How could that be? How could you possibly be a boy named Martin? It was just impossible. Your name was Jessica Remy. You were 15 years old and just starting high school. You couldn't possibly be anyone else, especially not a boy who you didn't even know.

"Jess, I understand what you're feeling right now. You probably don't believe me, but it's true." Megan said, her eyes starting to tear up as she looked down, averting your gaze.

"But Megs, you're not making any sense, how could I be Martin? I've never heard that name before in my life. I don't know who he is." You said, confused, trying to figure out what Megan was trying to say. "Just start from the beginning. Please tell me exactly what happened. I need to know." You said, placing your hand on her shoulder. Megan looked into your eyes for a minute, letting the tears run down her face, before rubbing them out and nodding.

"Alright. It all started a few years ago with the discovery of this remote." She said, gesturing to the device in her head. The more you looked at it, the more it felt familiar. "Martin, my brother, had gotten his hands on it, I have no idea how. He started using it and having fun with it's power. Eventually he did something to me that I couldn't forgive. I was really mad at him. Sarah and I were their too. We took the remote and were about to do something to him, when he grabbed it from us and ran. We had chased him home where he was hiding from us with the remote and were about to get it from him again. In order to hide, he used the GHOST function on the remote to possess your body. While he was in you, we got the remote back and decided that he had become corrupt from the remote. We were so mad we couldn't think straight. Sarah and I decided the world may be a better place if Martin were to disappear, and we used the PROGRAMMING mode to alter his mind. We made him become you not only in body, but in mind as well. And we used it to make everyone forget he even existed too. It was horrible. Eventually Sarah and I realized we were wrong and tried to reset everything, but it wouldn't work. Martin was gone forever." Megan said, as she began crying again. You realized that she truly felt horrible about what she did.

You were completely shocked. This was too much...You COULDN'T be Martin. Before now, you didn't even know who Martin was, and now you found out that he was you. No, it was too impossible. You'd have remembered something if you were Martin...

Then you remember all of the flashes and mood swings you'd been having. Maybe that was Martin's was of coming out to let you know he was alive inside you. It made sense but it was still hard to believe. You weren't mad at Megan for what she had done. You realized that she didn't mean it in the long run and that she truly regretted it. And somehow you knew that Martin would forgive her too.

"Megan, it's alright. I can't believe all of this, but I can believe that you feel horrible about what happened. If Martin saw you like this, I know he would forgive you." You said reassuringly, putting your hand on Megan's shoulder.

Megan looked up at you and smiled, tears glimmering in her eyes.

"Jess, I'm so sorry. I don't know what you're going through. I can only imagine that you're starting to get glimpses of Martin's life. I should never have done this. I should have just forgiven Martin for this. I know that I can't bring back the dead, but please, take this remote and use it. It's the least I can do for robbing you of your real life." Megan said, handing you the remote.

You took it from her hand, and as soon as it touched your hand, you felt an incredible sensation flow through you, as if your entire body were being filled with energy. Having the remote in your hand felt familiar. It felt right.

"Thank you Megan. And really, it's okay. I forgive you." You said, but you didn't know if you really believed it. You had a whole other life. A life you were only just starting to remember. You had friends, who now wouldn't even remember the original you. And you had a feeling that these memories slowly coming into your head was a sign that somewhere inside you, your original mind was still alive. You couldn't truly forgive Megan for taking that life away from you, but you could atleast let her feel better about it.

All you really knew for sure was that you had a lot to think over.

Everyone had been telling you to try out for cheer leading but you had never gone for it because you didn't want to be looked at as some stuck up slut.

No matter how you thought about your life you had come to the same conclusion. There was no way you could have been a guy. Even if the remote could erase your memories of having a brother, there was no way it was possible to change someone that drastically. Or could there...

She had returned to her original body, but she felt weird. Like something or someone was living in her head, but she tried to brush it away and went into deep slumber.

Early in the morning, you woke up with a start and yesterday's experience flooded into your mind, making you unsurprised by the fact that you're not in your own room and your body was not your own. You tossed the pink bedsheet away and quickly dressed, donning up tank top and denim short and took a pair of Sarah's sunglasses which was on her table, grabbed a cap and put on a grey jacket which was hung on the wall. You decided that morning attack was a better plan to reclaim your lost remote. Sarah and Megan wouldn't expect that you retained your memory and probably still snoozing away, dreaming a mischievous plan of their own.

It was barely dawn, as the first ray of sun could be seen in the horizon, you set off. 5am, good you thought and with that you carefully pocketed her wallet and put on a pair of trainers. You couldn't use the car, Sarah's parents would probably wake up and your plan would be foiled, not to mention that you could get questioned so you decided to go by bus. You tiptoed downstairs and made it out without even making a noise.

The journey was uneventful as you were more concerned about what to do when you get there. Various plans and schemes fleeted your mind, but you know they are useless if you can't get your hands on the remote. Pretty soon, you arrived, faster than you expected. In fact you're lucky that an old lady dropped off at the stop near your house, otherwise, you could've missed it.

You found yourself staring at your house as dawn just began to break and colored the sky bluish orange. You hid yourself well near some shrubs, as you caught a glimpse of Jenna running off to her usual morning jog. You waited and waited with bated breath until you couldn't see her anymore, the morning wind made you chatter as it brushed against your new legs. You gathered up courage and walked into the front door, turning the handle slowly and pushed, only to see Megan standing and looking at you with a smug grin.

'Hello Sarah,' Megan sneered as she turned and walked back to the stair leading up,' Come on follow me.'

There was a weird feeling to her voice but you couldn't turn away and run from your house, so you followed her to her room as she lead you.

Megan sat on her bed and you just stood in her room, uncertain about your fate. Could it be that Megan and Sarah had known that you didn't completely succumbed to become Sarah? You saw the remote on her hand and pondered whether to just snatch it from her.

'Not so fast,' Megan smirked again, as if she read your mind. 'I'll give it to you, in due time.' With that said, she stood up and hand you the remote, much to your surprise.

The next 10 minutes was spent as Megan told you that she was actually you. Another you which resided inside Megan's mind. Just like you inside Sarah's mind. You even tested her to see if this was a trap set up by Megan and Sarah, but Megan dismissed all your suspicion as she told you things that only you would know. 'I dunno how it was done, but I don't think it could happen again. A glitch, or something made this happen. Which is a good thing huh?' Megan concluded her explanation as you stared at her in disbelief.

'So where's Sarah?' you asked after all your wits had come back to you.

'Oh, she's trying out Jenna's body, she pressed the blue brainwash button and now Jenna's conciousness is in our old body and thinks that she is us. For me, I've been busy dressing our little sister with Jenna's clothes.', Megan was wearing Jenna's old tank top which was still a bit loose for her small frame and her own denim shorts which you've never seen her wore before.

'Wow, you really are me.', you voiced breathlessly, marvelling about the same clothing choice both of you had chosen for your bodies as you unzipped your jacket, letting the you in Megan to see that you had the same attire.

'I was gonna dress her up in lingerie, Jenna's, but she's too underdeveloped, basically I tried to make her like Jenna. Which would be hot.', Megan twirled her frizzy brown hair and sat down. 'So, what're we gonna do dude?', Megan asked you as she moved closer to your body. You flipped the remote several times, getting used to the feel again and breathed out a sigh of contentment as you ponder...

'Well,' Megan quipped,' Whatever you do, do it quickly. I feel that my sense of self is getting weaker and weaker. Who knows I might disappear completely and gets overrided by Megan's self again.' She finished with a worried tone in her voice. Some minutes has past and your clone in Megan had changed herself back into Megan's pyjamas.

You still had no clue of what to do, .twirling the omnipotent remote. You wanted Sarah and Megan to feel embarrased, to feel the despair that you felt while in Sarah's and Megan's body. You were certainly not evil, but the need for revenge clouded your mind.

'Tell you what, let's use Megan, and turned her against Sarah.', the clone in Megan spoke.

'You mean like, programming mode and made her into anoher me?' you asked.

'Nope, just normal swap with her so she can taste how betrayal is like, I'm fading soon, so do whatever you think is good,' Megan spoke before she fainted to the ground.

You decided to take your clone's advice, but you took 2 sleeping pills as well. As you began to feel drowsy, Megan stirred. What a stroke of luck you had these days! You positioned yourself inside Megan's closet, which was her place to store her comic books and hit the blue button with the last of your conciousness. Quick moment later, you felt your face rub against the carpet, while you hear a thud from the closet, as Sarah's body knocked against the wall, dozing off.

You picked yourself up, and closed the closet door with Sarah inside. You breathed a sigh of relief and waited. Pretty soon, you heard Sarah came back from her jog as Jenna and your dad and mom greeted her in the dining room as usual. According to Megan's memory, which you literally tore apart, Sarah had not done anything to them, she had better morality, just wanting to experience other's life and giving you punishment for your prank.

You pocketed the remote and went downstairs to have breakfast with the rest of the family. As the morning progressed, you stayed close to your parents so that Sarah couldn't ask you about the remote. When they were about to leave for work, you hurried to the bathroom and locked yourself there until you were certain that they had gone.

Sarah greeted you as you came out,' Hey Megan, did you take the remote?'

This was the cue for you to drop the bomb on her,' I, I feel that I should be the only one to hold the remote.', you acted, feigning Megan mustering her courage,'I want it for myself, it's not meant to be shared.'

Sarah was puzzled by the sudden change of attitude,'Megan, are you okay? Give me the remote please.' Sarah demanded as she took a step forward, which you reacted by taking two steps backward. As Sarah was in Jenna's body, she got Jenna's strength and agility, she could cover the distance and grabbed the remote off you very quickly.

'Sorry Sarah, you have to live as me from now on, Martin was better than you, at least he didn't try to wrench the remote from me.' and with that you pressed the red swap button intentionally, much to Sarah's horror.

The swap happen quickly and you hid your grin. Jenna's body was much much better than Megan's. More athletic and agile, the result of her training and discipline for years and you get to have it without breaking a sweat. You flexed your body as Megan stared at her hand in disbelief. The Sarah inside Megan tried to reason with you, and plead to give her the remote. 'Now Megan, we have to act in character.' you spoke to her,' Out of the way, twerp!' and you pushed her aside, went up and got ready to take a bath in Jenna's body. Meanwhile, you could hear Megan broke into tears.

As you pleasured yourself in the bath, you looked at the remote you put beside you. And you thought of what to do next.

There was still another you waiting to have fun.

"You're thinking what I'm thinking, right?" You asked. Sarah, your clone in her body, smiled and nodded.

"Of course. I am you after all." She said, winking. The two of you walked out of the room and over to Martin's room. You were going to knock on his door but Sarah help your hand in place.

"Why don't you let me do it? It'll be easier if he see's the girlfriend first, and then the bitchy sister." She said, smiling jokingly. You saw her point. After all, you knew full well, you wouldn't like Jenna barging into your room.

"Hey Sarah. It's nice to see you. I thought you were dumping me for my sister for a while." He said smiling. Since he couldn't remember the remote, you guessed that he thought it was odd for Sarah to spend so much time with Megan. His smile disappeared when he noticed you standing next to Sarah.

"I can't say I like your company though. What do you want?" He asked you, looking pissed off and ready to close his door again when Sarah took hold of his arm.

"Listen. We have something to tell you that you probably won't believe. It's easier if we just show you first." Sarah said, putting her other hand out. You knew what she was implying and gave her the remote. She pointed it at Martin and hit the normal swap button.

"What the heck did you do, Sarah?" Sarah's body asked. You could tell she was trying as hard as he could not to feel her breasts. You laughed at that.

"Relax, baby. It's the remote. It can swap bodies and has all kinds of features. Like I said, it's easier if we just showed it to you first." Martin said.

"Hey, Sarah, I just remembered, don't we have a loose end to tie up?" You asked. Martin's body looked at you and nodded.

"We'll be right back, baby. Don't have too much fun in my body." he said, kissing Sarah's body on the cheek. The two of you walked out of the room and closed the door.

"Wow, it feels weird. even though I'm you, I've never actually been in my body before." He said.

"So why don't we just tell him who we actually are?" You asked, ignoring his statement.

"Well you can tell him later. It would be easier on him thinking another version of himself took over his bitchy sisters life, but if he finds out we did it too his girlfriend it could become a problem." He said.

"Okay. So what do we do about the real Sarah, in Megan's body?" You asked. He looked like he was thinking for a little.

"Let's just program her too think she's Megan. She won;t remember the remote." He said.

"Okay, that's a good idea. But then what about Sarah's body? We can't just leave 'him' in it." You said, referring to the Martin in the room.

"I think I'll keep her body. I do really like it." He said. With that the two of you walked over to Megan's room. He gave you the remote and you walked into the room.

Megan, who used to be Sarah, was crying a little.

"Why are you doing this Megan?" She asked, thinking you were Megan. You pointed the remote at her and pressed the programming button.

"Umm, why was I crying?" She asked, dazed. Then she looked at you and practically jumped back terrified. "I...I didn't do anything to your room, J..Jenna." she said. She thought she was Megan now.

"Shut up, Twerp!" You said, leaving her room and slamming the door. You and your clone smiled at each other and went back into Martin's room. Sarah's body had a sly smile on her face.

"Don't worry, babe. I didn't look too much" She said. Your clone took the remote from you and pressed the swap button putting her back into her body. Martin looked disappointed.

"You'll have fun soon, Martin." she teased.

"Oh yeah, I guess I should ask. Why's Jenna here?" He asked. You could tell by the way he said her name, that he hated Jenna just as much as you did. You smiled at him and answered.

"I'm not Jenna. I'm you. Well, I'm another version of you. When you use the remote, your mind splits so there are two of us. One in you, and one in me." You said, trying to make it as easy for him to understand as possible, and lying so he thought the clone was Sarah.

"Okay, I think I understand now." Martin said, scratching his head a little.

"Good. So where too now, guys?" Sarah asked.

"But this is not m--" She continues speaking with a more sinister tone.

"as far as I am concerned and I... I am Martin. I like this body and this life. I felt a bit bad but clearly you have adjusted to being a girl and Megan quite well. So let's make this change permanent, O.K. Sis?"

You shake her hands off you and turn around with eyes as dark as a midnight raven. "I am not your sister, I'm your brother. You've been acting strange since you first did this and you know, you're still the same. Your life has changed but you haven't at all. You're running away from your life just like you were running from society before, hiding in your room." Your sharp tongue seemed to piercing Megan as she began to turn angry instead of nonchalant about the situation.

"Shut up! I don't need anyone telling me how to live my lif--" She begins but you cut her off as your mind is focused for once on what you wish to say.

"You can say that all you want but it's not true. You want someone to tell you how to live it, that's why you put me in your body. I proved you wrong, I have friends-- I as Megan have friends, a boyfriend and am no longer a virgin. You, both as Martin and Megan have none of that!"

"B--be quiet! I have friends, I have Sarah an--" Megan seems to be unraveled in her guilty pleasure of being someone else as her own self-conscious becomes usable once more.

"Sarah isn't always going to be here for you and you know you're not satisfied being this way at al-- You know what? It's been 3 months, summer is almost over and in a couple more weeks we'll have to go back to school. Do you really think you'll be any better off as me at school? You don't know how to be a guy or me, you'll fall apart."

You see tears in her eyes but before you can witness anymore, a loud snap rings your ears, your cheek begins to burn and before you know it you are lying on the ground; she slapped you, hard. "Shut up...just.." She whispers. You hear footsteps but your vision is blurred with your glasses removed. You rummage around on the floor, almost in tears from the pain on your cheek and shock. You put your glasses back on and begin fixing your hair before turning around to see Megan who is opening a... Anime DvD?

You gasp as you see the remote inside the casing, the sides are dug out so it could fit. "Y-you hid it in here?" You question.

Megan in tears, points the remote at you. You have little time to do much before...
132222112221221121122222211.title: Megan (Martin's body) seems unusually happy...

choices: Helen wants to live as Megan to see how her daughter's life is.
Helen wants to come with you when you confront Megan again.
1322221122212211211222222111.content:
Your heart begins to sink as the remote is pointed at you but jumps out of the water like a dolphin as the door to the room is hurled open by your mother. Megan jumps and almost drops the remote as she looks in dismay at her mother's entrance. Helen however, is wearing a scowl and already trying to interpret the situation by the expressions on our faces.

"What are you two doing up here!? I hear a lot of yelling com--" She pauses for a moment as she examines Megan. "--Martin are you crying? Megan, your face is red. What are you two doing? Answer me." She demands as she assesses the situation, lacking any correct information on it.

"U-umm.." You and Megan stutter as to come up with a response. Wearing the same personality as Megan is still nothing but trouble as you know you could come up with a great excuse for this if you were normal. She walks into the room more and confronts Megan or who she assumes is Martin. "Are you two fighting over this?" Helen asks as she tries to obtain the remote but Megan turns her body away and shelters the remote. "NO!" She screams.

"Give it here young man unless you want to be grounded for a few months." Helen says in a voice you have heard many times before. Along with the request, she also begins to grab the remote, this time gaining a grip on it. In only a moment you see your mother and sister fighting over the remote which only leads you to assume something unorthodox is about to occur.

The remote is doing anything but pointing in one direction and with four hands grappling it you are sure some sort of mishap is going to happen. You can only pray that it won't be directed at you but alas your thoughts are interrupted as you feel something being ripped from your hands. You stumble forward from the force and nearly fall into your own body whom you see only for a moment but she quickly runs out of the room. Your eyes stop following your original body as they lay on your sister's body, that you have been trapped in until now. She is looking at you in utter shock and you can't blame her.

You sigh and bring a hand to your head and straighten your dull blonde hair which now lays at about your neck in length. It is at this moment that you realize that you must be in mom's body. You take a moment to examine yourself, finding your chest slightly bigger than you are accustomed and your height being restored within an inch of what it used to be. Within that height, you're wearing a green pin-tucked blouse and a knee-length layered skirt.

You walk up to your previous body who just looks up at you in dismantled shock. "I-I guess I have some explaining to do." You say.

"What is going on? Why are yo-- am I over there?" She questions. You scratch your head on where to begin and decide that a mirror would be the easiest way to start. You grab the mirror from the desk and hand it to your mother who now occupies her daughter's body.

"This is what happened." You say as she looks into the mirror but instantly drops it to the floor as her vastly different image overtakes her. "This is... no way." Is all she says before she is on her knees, gazing into the mirror again. Grasping her less gentle dull blonde hair which is now in similar length to her own as Lisa helped you with your hair, cutting off most of it to relieve the mess that Megan's hair obtains after becoming a certain length. Grasping her face and massaging it with a gentle palm she asks "I'm in Megan's body? Then that means you're Megan?"

You fold your skirt under your legs as you sit down with a dampened smile. "Not quite. Feel like listening to a long story?"

"If it can explain this then by all means." She answers while pushing her new frames back into place.

You take a deep breath and try your best to explain everything that has happened to the best of your ability. You tell her how after your prank with your sister that you were pushed into Megan's body, her personality and whole life; That you have been Megan for the passed 3 months, how Megan treated you while you were in her body and the things you went through.

"So that's how it's been." You say. She seems over stimulated by the long response but finds herself understanding enough to reply. "That certainly is hard to believe. A remote that can change bodies, personalities and more. So you're Martin then?"

You nod. "Yes, though it is difficult to tell nowadays."

"Thinking back on it, Martin-- Megan I suppose was acting strange for awhile. I didn't think something like this was the cause though. I can't believe Megan put you through all that but besides that, Martin, how long have you had this thing and what kind of things have you done to us?" She raves.

You stand up off your sore legs and give a response "I told you, I didn't get a chance to really mess with anyone or anything before I was thrown into Megan's life and forced to stay this way. Today is the day I decided to ask for my body back and this is the result."

She stands up along with you and stretches a bit from the strain of sitting so awkwardly for so long. "Megan really dislikes herself but anyways, why did we switch?"

You sit on the edge of the bed, your hands succumbing to unwanted stress as they flinch about. "While you were struggling you must of hit the red button, now I'm in your body and you're in Megan's and the real Megan ran off with my body and the remote. It's not a very delightful situation." you answer.

"I see. I think we should tell your fath--" She begins but you cut her off.

"I-I think that is a bad idea. Megan isn't in a very good mood right now and if she gets a bunch of people chasing her, she might well... umm... good chance she'll use the remote in some way. I think it's best if we keep this to ourselves and not warrant even more displacement in our family."

"I see, well..."
1322221122212211211222222111.title: Someone comes into the room from the commotion .

13222211222122112112222221111.content:
"Well... I would like to stay this way for awhile. I want to experience this life that Megan hates so much." Helen says.

You plant a foot on the ground and put on a sour lip. "Her life isn't that bad now. I made friends, got her a boyfriend and improved her image but even still, Megan refuses to return to her life. Still, you can live her life, I could use a break from the stress of improving someone else's life but once I get Megan to--"

"I know, if you get Megan to return you to normal, that's fine. I have no intention of making my son live my life. How do you intend to get her to return you to normal?" She asks as she kicks her feet against the bed, eyes planted on the pocket mirror in her hand.

You give a sigh and shrug in response. "I don't know. I am thinking that confronting Sarah would be best but I am certain that Megan is already going to Sarah's to hide. It's late, I may just put this off until tomorrow. Letting her cool off might not be a bad idea either. In-fact, I will."

"Alright, I'm tired as well. I guess we're in my temporary room now so goodnight mom." She laughs as she closes the mirror and jumps to her feet. You notice how much more perky your mother is at the moment and feel that she could very well be enjoying this. Currently, you could careless if she is or isn't as she is in a body you don't want to return to anytime soon.

You leave the room without a comment on her rude emphasize and head towards your parents' room. The light is off and your father is already fast asleep. Despite being uneasy about sleeping next to your father, you quickly change into a nightgown and head to bed.

You wake up the next day and find being in your mother's room a rude awakening. The events from before are real is your first thought as you climb out of bed. Rubbing the sharp pain in your back, you head over to your mother's dresser where you pick out some clothes that will suit you; a white tank top with a denim blazer along with a pair of tight jeans. You carry them to the bathroom and strip of your nightgown.

"It's been awhile since I've seen mom naked. Ha..ha.." You say, disliking how disturbing it sounds. Still, you can't help but notice how much different your mother's body is from Megan's. "I--It may just be Megan's personality but mom looks... really pretty." Her body is toned and though she has a few wrinkles on her face, her overall figure is superior to Megan's in most ways.

With the shower done, you head downstairs for the first time as your mother. You run your hands through your hair, finding it much softer than Megan's, it was smooth and felt good on your fingers and on your cheeks. You enter the kitchen to find your mother cooking breakfast in Megan's body. As soon as your heeled boots hit the tiled floor, she turns around. "Oh, hi mom."

Despite being completely aware of what is going on, seeing Megan's body call you mom gives you a eerie shiver. "M-Morning."

You also notice Jessica sitting at the table, batting her legs against the chair in impatience. "Mommy, why is Megan making me breakfast? I want you to." She whines. Again you feel bizarre being called mom but reply without much hesitation. "Umm, Mommy overslept and it's nice to have your sister make breakfast sometimes."

"But I want you to make it!" She cries out, filling out her personality flawlessly.

"It'll taste just like Mommy makes, I promise." You say which seems to be enough to quiet her down. You feel awkward already but at the very least you no longer have to deal with Megan's life-- just your mother's. You gaze at Helen, finding it weird to see Megan from the 3rd person. After all, for 3 months that has been your appearance.

You get breakfast out of the way and Helen agrees to watch the house today so you can go out as her to confront Megan who still didn't return home. It's already 10 A.M. so you decide to look...
13222211222122112112222221111.title: Mother's perspective.

132222112221221121122222211112.content:
With the mall being one of the last places Megan would go on her own you decide to check there first as you have a good feeling Sarah may drag her there. Being out of your own life for so long, you know little about how Sarah or Megan have been or what they have been doing. Your only clear notion is that Megan has been acting different but from her reaction to last night's quarrel, you can tell she is still herself.

The trip to the mall is swift and easy as you find having a car and driver's license of your own a handy part of being your mother. You wander through the mall for quite awhile, keeping your pace on the main hallways and merely glancing into each store or restaurant but find little sign of Megan or Sarah. With little more to check you sit down at one of the benches in the middle of the mall and sigh.

"Only thing I have seen today are a few men checking me out." You whisper but find the aspect of men enjoying your presentation awkward and begin to blush. You look yourself over and wonder if maybe you shouldn't have worn such tight clothing. As you pick up your purse and are about to leave you catch a glimpse of Sarah and Megan out of the corner of your eye. The pressure in your stomach builds as you walk over to them. Mindlessly lost in chat, they don't notice you until you are right in their faces. Megan seems startled but replies "Oh umm, H-hey umm... mom?"

You flinch a bit as she calls you mom but realize that Megan isn't aware what swap function was used on you. Having not prepared any dialogue, you hesitate and go along with being your own mother.

"Hey. I'm not sure why but your sister has been in hysterics and told me to come get you. I'm not sure what's wrong with her so could you come home and figure out what is bothering her? She won't tell me a thing as always but she sure was acting strange, did something happen?" You say.

They both stare at you for a moment until they pass glances at each other and laugh. "Y-yeah, I'll be home in a bit mom, Sarah and I are almost done here." Is all they say before walking passed you and into the nearest store, giggling away. Once out of sight you pursue them a bit and try to eavesdrop on them. In the store you find no trace of them but hear a few whispers as you head towards one of the changing rooms. You quietly go into the room next to theirs and listen.

"--n't believe that. Mom must of hit the blue button and now Martin thinks he is mom, how perfect, serves him right." Megan says with a detestable spunk in her voice. You hear Sarah laugh in response. "Yeah, he deserves it after what he did to you last night. I can't believe he said such terrible things about your life and personality and even slapped you."

"Yeah, I even offered to switch him back but he shouted that he didn't trust me but I still tried but mom came in before I could." Megan says. You are in shock and with Megan's personality leading your emotion's you almost begin to cry. 'Megan twisted the events that happened last night and told it to Sarah. I can't believe her!' you yell in your head.

Intrigued by the awful lies thus far you continue listening with inflated ears.

"Well he deserves another 3 months in your body if he is going to be like that." Sarah lays her opinion on the matter using only her twisted lies as facts.

"It's 3 months as Mom now, body, personality and memory." Megan says. You begin to hear some rustling as they appear to be leaving. You curl up your body so it isn't shown above or below the small door.

"Speaking of that, how are you going to handle your mother? She is in your body now, right?" Sarah asks.

"Yeah, I'm not sure how I'll handle that..." is the last bit you can hear before their voices are too far away to make out. You leave the room, hands shaking from stress on how you are going to handle this situation.

"I don't want to spend another 3 months as Megan or as Mom. What should I do?"
132222112221221121122222211112.title: Twisted lies.

1322221122212211211222222111121.content:
You hustle out of the mall, the clacking of your heels only about a 3rd of the noise received as you stumble over and over again. To any other aged women or even teenagers, you must be seen as a poor display of a woman and that present humiliation and altered personality makes you cringe, almost willing to sacrifice your haste under the audiences unspoken comments. "I.. I hate this personality so much." You say between your hustled breaths. You don't see Sarah or Megan on your way out of the mall but pray that is because you are parked on opposite ends and not that they are this far ahead of you.

You find yourself overly panicked and end up speeding your way home but to your dismay, it catches the attention of an officer. You lay your head on the steering wheel and almost cry as you wait for the officer to approach.

"Do you know how fast you were going?" He asks.

"N--no..." You respond. The conversation ends with you 5 minutes delayed and fined a few hundred dollars. "Great!" You shout as you take up the road again.

Your heart only crushes more as you park into your driveway...next to Sarah's car. You habitually readjust your hair in the rear view mirror before getting out of the car; a habit you forced onto yourself in order to make Megan look presentable. You step lightly into your home, the energies surrounding it feeling weighed and obese. You notice Jessica taking it upon herself to try and grab a pack of crackers from the counter but falling short. Your father seems absent as he often is.

You hear Sarah's voice as you enter a little further, coming from upstairs from Megan's room. You nervously take yourself up the stairs to her room, finding Megan, Sarah and your mother all present. All three of them glare at you as you enter.

"Seems you're not really brainwashed into being mom." Megan states. Sarah walks towards you and glares at you for a moment before turning a brief head towards Helen. "Sorry about this Mrs. Remy." She says before turning her head back around and slapping you in the face. You recovery fairly quickly but are still stunned-- an expression that wears itself quite visibly on your face. "I can't believe how you treated Megan! Calling her life and body disgusting and even slapping her even after she offered to swap back with you, how could you?" Sarah raves at you but nothing but utter disgust writes itself on your face. "What!? That's not true, Megan has been telling you lies. She slapped me first of all and I am the one who asked her to switch me back but she refused. Mom can attest to this, I told her everything!" You explain.

She says. You can't help but erupt yet stumble over what to say. "You what? Everything they... it's not true! My face was red and she was crying, remember? She obviously slapped me and if she lied about that then what's to say she wouldn't lie about everything else?" You protest.

"Well I was thinking since she clearly hasn't learned anything and it's already been a few months, why not just make this permanent?" She suggests.

"P--permanent!?" You cry out beneath your tears. Both Sarah and mom look uncertain and eye each other carefully in thought. Megan however seems quite disliking of their second thoughts and continues to warp their sense of justice more. "Come on, it's been a few months. I've kind of adjusted to being Martin and Martin has adjusted to being me despite not wanting to be me. You didn't even know we were like this until just now mom." "And Sarah, you can't tell me you still want to go out with Martin after all this can you?" She asks. You only continue to cry as Sarah confirms that she indeed has no intentions of going out with you ever again. "You can still be friends with Martin, he'll just be you know... Megan." Megan says and Sarah merely nods lightly along with her.

"Still, I want both my kids to be happy." Mom affirms. You wish to speak up about how you'll never be happy about being this way but refrain from it as you know it would only irritate the situation even more and further prove Megan's point that her life isn't very alluring. Megan gently presses both her hands together with a smile of assurance as she speaks. "Don't worry mom. Martin-- rather Megan and I will be just fine this way. She'll learn how to respect others' difficulties as well. This experience will be good for her development for sure."

"Well, I suppose I only noticed slight changes before I realized about the remote. I guess it's alright then." Your mother agrees finally which only causes you to cry out once more in a breaking voice. "B--but mom!" She only glances at you briefly, looking a bit ill-- though you believe it's more because she is seeing her own body crying shamefully on the floor rather than the fact her son is upset.

Sarah pulls out the remote from her purse and hands it to your mother who grabs it quite enthusiastically. No sooner is it in her grasp is it pointed at you. You can barely see through the blur inducing tears that pile upon your eyes but your vision clears from a pair of glasses as you find yourself now risen from the ground, standing with your arms raised outward as if just a moment ago you were holding something. The sudden relief from the emotions you gathered into your mother's body is enough to allow you to formulate some sort of objection to this before the emotions settle themselves into your new body. "You can't do this! I-- I'm not the real Megan!" You shout, an eye twitching from the squeaky voice you only recently got the luxury of not hearing from first-person.

Your mother climbs to her feet, scraping away the tears from her eyes. "Sorry sweetie but I think this is a good change for both of you." She states. Megan and Sarah soon join her on the other side of the room near the door.

"We'll leave you alone for a little bit." Mom says as they all begin to leave until Sarah brings up an overlooked section of the punishment. "Hey. Since he can't return to normal now, shouldn't you give him his personality back?" She brings to the attention of your mother and Megan.

"I think this personality suits her better." Megan states quickly while your mother looks absentmindedly at you and Megan.

"I forgot you made such a change to him. I suppose it was kind of silly of me to not notice what with how he has been acting. I agree with Sarah, forcing a change in how he thinks isn't a good thing considering he needs to learn for himself now, not from your thoughts Megan." She explains to the audience before winding the remote upwards once more. The tears in your eyes still continue to exhale from your eyes but the scared and frightened emotions that have been enveloping you for so long fade to a dim light, a more vivid burn arising in your anger and frustration.

"Everything she is saying is a fucking lie! She just wants to get out of her own life! All this started with some stupid joke and she continues to place me off as some terrible person." You shout out in a passionate voice that you could never make with Megan's mindset.

"Enough young ma-- No. The punishment is decided so that would be young lady!" Your mother demands for your silence but you do not comply by any means.

"She is twisting all the events so much. I worked my butt off to make her life better. I did a lot of things I never would of done and it was hard as hell with Megan's emotions being so... hard to deal with. I want some credit-- not punishment! Especially sentencing me to being my own sister for life!" You scream out as you position yourself closer to them. They all remain under Megan's persuasion which only infuriates you and causes you to leap for a grab at the remote. Megan positions herself in front of mom quickly and without much time to retaliate at all you are slammed to the floor with your arm clasped behind your back. "Ow!" You yelp.

"Stop that!" Your mother and Sarah both shout. You struggle to get free from Megan's clutches but can't even cause her to budge off of you even a bit. "Did you forget you're a small unfit little girl?" Megan whispers into your ear leaving a infuriating sense of superiority.

"So now what?" Megan says as if restraining you was no big deal at all. "She's just a filthy liar..." You struggle to say under the weight of your own body sitting on top of you.

"Well this is definitely a good thing for you." Your mother responds with folded arms. The weight finally leaves as Megan steps off of you. You cradle your arm in your hand and weakly get to your feet, a clear-cut scowl of detest on your face.

"Let's leave him alone." Sarah suggests. They all agree and leave the room, closing the door quietly behind them.

Which while not an awful thing, is definitely something to consider in the long run. "She would probably believe me at this point anyways..." You say as you place the remote back inside your fluffy friend.

With the hassle of your mother gone and your desire to keep Sarah in Megan's shoes for awhile longer, you continue to burn your days away as Sarah. It's enjoyable being a woman of a desirable status, no longer walking around with darting eyes that question everyone's thoughts as you pass by them. Among that it's nice to regroup with your former set of friends before you became forced to generate new ones as Megan-- though, you are quite sure a few of your friends actually have a thing for you or Sarah specifically. Of course, you could just be citing words for them.

After finishing the two weeks time you decide to call up the real Sarah to see how she has been doing. "Hello?" You hear her ask, a drowsy lisp in her voice. "Hi Megan, it's Sarah." You respond as if all is in the norm, utilizing the same cruel behavior they toyed with on you. Her tone instantly lowers, her interest aroused by her hatred... "What do you want?" She queries, the exhaustion in her voice evaporated by your stress-inducing call. "Nothing much, I was just wondering if you wanted to go out to breakfast with me?" You answer.

"Why would I want to go out with you?" She spits back, an expected arrangement of words at the very least. "Because if you don't-- well, let's just say you may want to get used to wearing those glasses." You threaten, leaving nothing but a clean minute of silence until she finally speaks up, sounding as though she just stopped crying... "W--When?" She asks after a loud sniff. "I'll come pick you up right now." You declare, garnering a farewell which pushes it's disdain into you.

---

You arrive at your former home, finding Sarah standing diligently on the front lawn, dressed in a uninspired set of jeans and a white T-shirt. "Come on now, I got so many better looking clothes for you to wear, Megan. Why dress like your oldself?" You tease as she climbs inside the car, her gaze shifting between anger and embarrassment. The discomfort you place into her makes you grin a bit and pass a hand through your dark hair with satisfaction. "Come on now Megan, this is supposed to be a friendly visit." You assure her, a bit hypocritical as you do plan on teasing her quite a bit more. "Yeah right..." She mumbles softly, looking out of the window at the beautiful rising sun which glimmers off the window's edge.

In the window you can see your mother and Megan staring at you, their expressions masked by distance and thick purple curtains. Rest assured you know they're angry but in an act which may only anger them more you wave to them wearing a gentle smile before driving off. Sarah remains silent but you notice her diligent eyes which search the car as well as the pockets of your clothing. "It's in my left pocket but unless you want to risk crashing the car, I suggest you don't try for it." You state. She veers away from you as if she was guilty of no such thing but it only leaves you with a sly grin.

After seating yourselves at a well distance from anyone else and ordering some food you decide to crack open the shy capsule which surrounds your former girlfriend. "Now then, how's being Megan been for you? I'm really curious." You ask as you weigh your head down on your standing arms. Her eyes thin to an angry glare of frustration-- though her line of sight still remains away from your own. "Be honest too." You add with a small chuckle. You can see the thoughts forming in her head, desperately trying to come out in a provocative way but unable as Megan's shyness prevents it. "Fine..." She submits softly.

"I hate it. I hate-- I hate caring so much about everything. E--even now I..." The words carry out of her mouth as a disorderly mess, soft and weak to the ear. "It's annoying, eh? You want to look good so when everyone around you looks at you they enjoy it, yet you know you can never look that good and it makes you feel awful. You want to shout at the tops of your lungs but you don't want to draw attention to yourself; fearing embarrassment. Yeah, that's being Megan alright." You say, your words leaving Sarah only nodding in agreement yet still infuriated by you.

"That's what Megan wants to hear, I think." She says, a strange statement you're not quite positive that you make sense of. "What do you mean?" You ask.

"What I mean is, you were saying things to Megan like... 'Oh, your life isn't so bad and I did this and I did that' but... e--even if you enjoyed her life a tiny bit, you hate it just like she did. I think she wanted to see you fail and say that you hate being her and that her life sucks. And... yeah..." She deduces, perhaps a way of thinking brought on by Megan's personality or perhaps by the real Sarah. Regardless, it does leave you thinking if Megan really is upset with you for that reason. Sure you got her a boyfriend and felt happy sometimes but for the most part you really were miserable even after getting her life a bit more in order. However, you know it's awful and near unforgivably cruel of Megan to wish for your failure and to force you into her life for good. Still...

It doesn’t last long though as she shakes her head wildly all of the sudden. “But no, I know for a fact I’m not pretty. Yet I… feel like I am.” She states, the battle of her new personality beginning, a struggle you know well. “It’s called self-confidence. I made you think you’re actually quite pretty and I also…” You cut yourself off as you sit down next to her and hand her the remote. She looks at you as if you were going to stab her but gently rubs the remote. “Don’t press any of the buttons please.” You ask of her, to which she nods appealingly. “I also made you exceptionally nice since you seem to have an issue with getting upset very easily. If you had your old personality you would be bashing those buttons like crazy.” You finish, the whole while her eyes remain locked on the remote. “I want to press the buttons but oh, it would be so rude of me since you said I couldn’t. I’m sorry for even thinking it.” She admits but her new conscience weighs down on her desires for revenge and so she hands the remote back to you freely. You take it back with a smile and lift yourself from her bed and prepare to leave. “W--wait, this isn’t right. This isn’t me.” She labels her concerns, a hand reaching out for your aid.

“You were ready to let me live under a false personality and body. You’ll get used to it. Now you won’t be as miserable even if it’s not how you were born.” You explain before leaving the room and the distorted Megan. You only make a couple steps down the hallway before bumping into your old body. “Sorry.” You blurt out on instinct. She looks up at you and then down the hall, piecing together who you are and where you came from quite easily. “D--did you just apologize to Megan?” She asks, her voice cracking from her shock.

You begin to twist and twirl your bangs, gazing away from her as the misfortune of her assumption falls into the recesses of your mind. “Yeah, well… I tried to smooth things over but it didn’t go so well so I sort of… changed her personality a bit.” You admit with an awkward chuckle, one which prays she won’t get upset with you. Her brow falls into such a state though and so the questions begin… “What did you do to her?”

“I just gave her some self-confidence.” You answer, be it only half of what you did. Sarah’s anger falls along with her shoulders, the tense bit of frustration losing itself behind her agreement. “Oh, well, t--that’s probably better for her anyways.” She admits, an agreement you have no plans on losing by telling her about the other half of the personality change. You watch her bashfully look back and forth, a hand ravaging her short hair leaving it as a mess with no direction. “Speaking of personalities… can I please have mine back?” She pleads yet again. You follow her previous action to the letter before replying with… “But if I do that you’ll get angry at me.”

“I’m already angry at you.” She swiftly points out in a way that leaves you snickering. “Well, you’ll be more vocal about it.” You reason, something she doesn’t seem to be able to deny. “I’d like to say I won’t b-but… I probably will yell at you; a lot…” An admittance that leaves you wondering whether or not you want to deal with such a thing at the moment.

You’re a bit surprised when you find Megan greeting you home with a bright smile and a plate of eggs, bacon and toast. “Uh…” You exhume as you awkwardly take up the plate, a bit hesitant to even assume it’s for you. “Thank you?” You say with a dubious stare. Her smile flickers before she returns herself to the kitchen. “I realized I’ve been rather obnoxious. I really did kind of put everything off on you, I’m sorry.” She says, turning about with eyes fueled by sincerity. You are about to accept such an offering until you hear Sarah blurt out quite the objection. “What on earth did you do to her!?”

The blank stares both you and Megan give her do little to settle her down as she further explains herself. “Self-confidence you say but there is no way Megan would forgive you just because you gave her confidence.” She states, her drowsy eyes flaring into focus. “He also made me nicer.” Megan answers for you, her hands wrapping themselves in a towel with a smile still proudly on display. It leaves Sarah with her mouth fallen, anger setting itself aside for you while her current shock remains on the content Megan. “He did the same thing to me.” Your mother says as she passes by Sarah.

“You too!? A--and you’re not mad at him?” Sarah exclaims, her expression unmoving. Your mother begins to make herself a cup of coffee, a shrugging shoulder from beneath her bathrobe the start of her response. “Of course I am but… I don’t really want to yell at him for it. Besides, he’s being nice in his own way. I do wish he would return my little girl to this family though, I don’t like her being someone else’s daughter.” The answer leaves Sarah with a palm to her face, one that is only aided as Megan speaks up once more. “I know we’re not ourselves or anything but… well, I’ve never felt happier.”

“But it’s only because he made you feel that way, it’s not how you really feel!” Sarah claims, a hand pointing at your direction but you only continue to eat the nice gesture from Megan. Both your mother and Megan don’t seem to know how to respond to it but to be frank, you’re actually enjoying the change even if it does feel artificial. “Change them back, Martin! If they say they want to stay with that personality after you change them back then fine.” Demands Sarah, shortening herself on the chair across from you. You push the plate away from you and formulate some sort of response… “It’s nice like this though…” You conclude, turning towards Megan to further your words. “Besides, I’ll be a nice sister for Megan unlike Jenna and wouldn’t you like to have Sarah as an older brother, Megan?”

“I’d love to have her as a brother or sister. She’s more or less been like one anyways.” Megan replies with an excited grin, hands clenched with happiness at her chin. “Megan…” Sarah whispers, her happy state-- false though it be, indenting itself into her mind. “I don’t know why you don’t just give being me a shot, it’ll be good for Megan.” You say.

Sa--Sarah, why would you do that?” Your mother questions, her tone just barely sounding frustrated. “See? He made you both stupidly nice. You can’t say you’re thrilled by the idea of returning the two to normal as you know it’ll only lead to more anger but regardless of such a worry, you fetch the remote anyways.

You return them both to normal within a few seconds of each other, a harsh stare forming on your mother’s drenched face while an unsure feeling rising up in Megan’s gut. “How dare you do that to me!” Your mother exclaims as she takes a bold step toward you, a step backward being your defense. “More than that, what do you think you’re doing taking your sister’s body? I don’t want Jenna to be someone else’s daughter, return her to normal this instant.” Your mother demands but you discard the suggestion like moldy bread, not even letting it sit for a chance of redemption. “She’s happy being Sarah and besides, once she moves out she’ll more or less be in the same position she is in right now-- out of the house. She still knows you’re her mother.” You explain but it proves to not soothe your mother at all.

Meanwhile, Megan silently walks passed everyone looking rather disheartened, an excuse big enough to get away from your mother and one that draws in Sarah’s attention as well. Megan seems not the least bit pleased as you both enter her room after her however. “Wh--what do you two want? Can’t I be alone for two seconds…?” She barks like a small puppy. “You seem upset, are you alright? Are you mad at Martin for changing you?” Sarah asks as she climbs aboard her bed to console her but it only leaves her diverting yet again… “I’m fine…” She says.

You close the door and follow on up to Megan, your presence not seeming to induce the same emotion in Megan as it used to. No longer is she looking away from you out of spite but rather she seems ashamed. “What’s wrong?” You ask, your eyes opening to her concerns. “I--It’s nothing…” She continues to say but you know it to be false. “Megan…” You call her name softly, her face meeting yours for only moment before she cries out into a burst of tears. Confused but also sensing concern and fright deep in your gut, you ask once again… “What’s wrong?”

“I just…” She tries to speak but her words get cut off as her throat begins to clench from her emotions, a hand covering over her eyes from beneath her glasses. Not from anger or self-pity but from another source of sadness these tears come, a crevice of Megan’s mind you really wish for her to show you. “Are you upset with Martin?” Sarah asks yet again but it amazingly leaves Megan shaking her head. “No… it’s just I-- him making me so nice made me… realize that I really wanted to… s--say I’m s--sorry…” She admits between the breaks of her rapid breath. “That’s just because he made you nice, you don’t really--” Sarah begins to say but once more Megan shakes her head. She then turns to you, showing to you her tear-drenched face. “I got so deep into what I did I just… I just knew I had to keep going. I-- I thought that if I kept you as me then… then maybe we’d be equal. I’d still have trouble talking with people b--but at least I’d be… b-better looking and more confident. You showed me how easily you could handle being me and it only made me more angry… I just wanted us to be even… I’m sorry, I’m really sorry!” She slowly sobs out her feelings. An actor is something you have never known Megan for and it’s with that knowledge that you find yourself becoming enveloped by your little sister’s sadness as you often used to. You take her to you, pressing her face gently against your chest, your arms wrapped tightly around her meek frame. “It wasn’t easy being you…” You say gently, an echoing of her apology vibrating against your chest.

You remain hugged against her for a couple minutes, smiling gently from the old feelings… “See, this is what I’m talking about. Now Sarah and me can be with you all the time.” You say with a soft chuckle. You finally push her away from you, her tears mostly dried and a brief smile meeting Sarah’s. “I’m sorry for lying to you so much Sarah.” She says, her head drooping once more… “I was--- I slapped Martin when he asked for his body back, he... rarely insulted my life and I did harass him everyday when he came home.”

“Don’t fret about it.” Swoons Sarah with a perky smile.

You’re relieved to see such a scene come into reality and in an insane act to prove Megan’s apology you hand to her the remote. “If you really want to be someone else, I won’t stop you but I think you should stay as you are.” You say towards Megan’s completely stunned face. She looks at the remote which lay upon her lap and…

You take it with a questionable hand, your head tilting with curiosity. “I--I really, really, really want to be someone else b--but… I know I shouldn’t.” She admits, the brief chuckle that emanates from her so false and unsteady that you wonder if she would be crying if she didn’t already expel all of her tears.

I haven’t showered yet and I just came from a long run!” You blurt out, laughing along with them simply out of relief. The past three months have done nothing but make you miserable, you’re happy to have it over even if things aren’t the normal you were expecting.

“I’m not sure if I’ll want to stay this way for good but for three months you can call me Martin if you want, Megan.” Sarah tells her with a hand softly pressed upon her shoulder. “I guess I should get used to being called Jenna, huh?” You exhume with a snicker and hand scratching loose your ponytail by mistake. Megan lets out of a cute but abrupt set of laughs before smiling at the both of you. “It’s nice… having things this way. I’ve--I've always wanted you to be my sister, Sarah but I guess a--a brother is just as good and I sort of… kind of wanted Jenna to be nice to me so-- yeah, it’s cool seeing her be that way.” Says Megan, a bit unsure of how to express herself as her hands twiddle with each other between her legs.

You smile in return but rise from Megan’s cluttered bed with a long stretch. “I’m glad things are fine now. Do you guys mind telling mom? I sort of want to take a shower.” You ask of them, a simple nod sufficing…

Though your mother objects to having her first born child no longer among her children, she eventually lets it slide simply for Megan’s sake. And so your life continues, skewed off it’s course to adjust to Jenna’s path but while hanging around with Jenna’s shallow friends is tough, you find yourself readjusting her life to suit you quite easily.

Megan frequents her insecurities but with you and Sarah (or Martin as you begin to refer to her as.) always there when she returns home, you feel you’re not too far off from calling her a happier person. Though all of the changes you made to her life confuse her for quite awhile-- Norman in specific. Three months later…

You arrive home from college after a long day, a bit exhausted by the boring lecture you had to deal with. Upon entering your room you find Sarah there with the remote in hand and a puzzled expression. “What’s up, Martin?” You ask as you take a seat beside her on the bed. She looks up at you with a solemn gaze, one which accompanies her response quite well… “Hey. It’s been three months and I was just deciding if I wanted to go back to normal or not.”

“It’d be weird not having you as a little brother.” You say, folding your legs Indian style with a hand slowly running through your long hair. She nods and puts the remote back on the nightstand where it’s been since that day; wide open for use. “Really? I’ve gotten used to this but I still don’t feel like I should be this way. I like being your little brother and everything but-- you don’t mind if I go back to normal do you?” She asks, her face pressing itself only inches from your own. “I--I think it’s more of an issue of Megan than me. I like you this way but you know I liked you before too.” You tell her, a fact which brings her face falling onto the bed sheets. “Ugh… she’s going to hate me…” You hear through the thick layers of cloth.

You drag her off of the bed however and into Megan’s room, who is laying on her bed as usual. “Hey guys.” She greets with a pleasing smile. “Hey…” Sarah replies softly, her steps slowing to a dull pace. “Look, Megan…” She begins, her hands cupped at her waist with unease. “Don’t get too upset but I’m going to return to my normal body now.” She finishes, her eyes finally meeting Megan’s which course with surprise. “W--what? Why!?” She exclaims.

“I just don’t feel comfortable this way. I’ll still be here a lot, I just won’t be your brother, I’ll be your friend like before.” Explains Sarah but it doesn’t settle well into Megan who has come to love her new family. “But I like you being my brother.” She whines out but it leaves Sarah shaking her head. “I know you do, I like it too but it’s just not me. I had a good time these three months and being a boy is… unique… but I just want to be myself. I stayed this way for your sake but it’s time I did what I want, understand?” She says, hands cupping at her chest and her eyes solemn with sincerity. You can sense Megan’s desire to object once more but as she looks at you and the gentle shaking of your head, she settles herself down and gives Sarah the agreeing nod she was looking for. “Fine…” She whispers.

“Great. Thank you Megan. You’ll always be my little sister no matter what I look like.” Sarah says before dispersing from the room along with you.

You drive yourselves to Sarah’s home and knock on the door but only get her mother, Alisha. “Is Sarah here?” You ask but she completely ignores you, her attention falling onto Sarah and only her. “Oh, Martin. It’s been quite a long time since you have been here. I’m sorry about Sarah breaking up with you, she just suddenly seemed so different, I’m not sure what happened.” She says, continuing to gossip with Sarah for a few minutes before finally answering your question. “She went out for a run, she should be back soon. You can wait inside if you want.” She offers but you decline and instead wait at the edge of the sidewalk for her.

“Come to think of it, I haven’t seen her since I swapped with her.” You realize, a bit of an astounding feat considering it is your former sister. Sarah sighs with a shaking head… “I see her at school. I don’t know how I’m going to undo what she’s done to me.” She mumbles with a hand burying her head. The words feed your curiosity to it’s breaking point and so you begin scanning the paths to Sarah’s home for any signs of her.

After several minutes you finally see her fade into sight and as she gets closer and closer you can feel your heart pounding to the vibrations of her steps. She’s dressed in an identical outfit to your own running outfit and you can tell from here that her hair is significantly longer. In-fact as she gets closer you notice her hair is styled identically to your own, albeit still frizzier but Jenna has done a great job of straightening Sarah’s hair. It’s not until she takes notice of you two that you can really see the rest of her body clearly and it’s then that you begin to feel rather-- well, turned on. Sarah has always been attractive but you never would have imagined she would have looked so much better if she worked out a little. In a way you’re a bit jealous and while your legs and butt are still way better, you can’t help but wish you had a chest like hers.

“What a surprise, what are you two losers doing here?” She asks as she settles herself down to a stop, her gaze mostly falling on you. She scans you from top to bottom several times before popping a cocky grin without a word, most likely smug about looking ‘so much better than you.' An odd thing to think considering she has really turned Sarah into another 'Jenna.'

“Nothing much…” You say as you ready the remote…
